vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Ἰσαάκ
(in MSS. sometimes -σάκ; cf. Deiss., BS, 189; Thack., Gr., 100), ὁ
indecl.
(in FlJ, Ἴσακος, -ου), (Heb. יִצְחָק),
Isaac (Gen.17:19, al.): Mat.1:2, Rom.9:10, al
(From Abbott-Smith. LSJ has no entry)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.17.19;
son of: Abraham (H0085) and Sarah (H8283);
half-brother of: Ishmael (H3458), Zimran (H2175), Jokshan (H3370), Medan (H4091), Midian (H4080), Ishbak (H3435) and Shuah (H7744); married to Rebekah (H7259);
father of: Esau (H6215) and Israel (H3478)
§ Isaac, "he [God] laughs"
Isaac, (Proper name), indeclinable, Mt. 1:2; 8:11; 23:32; Acts 3:13. Rom. 9:7f.; Gal. 4:28; Heb. 11:9ff.; Jas. 2:21
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
以撒 这个陽性專有名詞在希伯來字的意思是 "笑"
亞伯拉罕與妻子撒拉所生的兒子
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
以撒 这个阳性专有名词在希伯来字的意思是 "笑"
亚伯拉罕与妻子撒拉所生的儿子
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: Y-sác « cười » « người đang cười» Xem H3327
